ThingDef.label: matchlock pistol
ThingDef.description: Muzzle-loading matchlock pistol.\n\nFires a huge projectile, but it's accuracy leaves much to be desired, and reloading is a lengthy affair.

ThingDef.label: matchlock arquebus
ThingDef.description: Muzzle-loading matchlock arquebus.\n\nFires a huge projectile, but it's accuracy leaves much to be desired, and reloading is a lengthy affair.

ThingDef.label: double-barrelled shotgun
ThingDef.description: Breech-loading double-barrelled shotgun.\n\nFiring two lethal shots in quick succession, this shotgun is easily capable of removing limbs in a single burst, but only when in the hands of a capable shooter.

ThingDef.label: breech-loading rifle
ThingDef.description: Breech-loading rifle.\n\nPossessing excellent accuracy, range, and damage, this rifle is limited only by it's rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: revolver
ThingDef.description: Single-action revolver.\n\nNot exactly the fastest firing handgun available, but still a perfectly capable weapon when used up close and personal.

ThingDef.label: pump-action shotgun
ThingDef.description: Pump-action shotgun.\n\nLimited in range, but easily one of the most lethal weapons available for CQB.

ThingDef.label: lever-action rifle
ThingDef.description: Lever-action rifle.\n\nConsiderably faster firing than a traditional bolt-action rifle, but hindered by a fairly mediocre catridge.

ThingDef.label: bolt-action rifle
ThingDef.description: Bolt-action rifle.\n\nTreading a fine line between power, and speed of operation, the bolt-action rifle is a solid choice for most ranged firefights.

ThingDef.label: bolt-action sniper
ThingDef.description: Bolt-action rifle, equipped with a precision rifle scope.\n\nThe addition of a magnified optic makes identifying targets at longer ranges much easier, but limits close range capablity.

ThingDef.label: semi-automatic pistol
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated short-recoil pistol.\n\nThe lack of raw damage dealt by this pistol is easily offset by it's rate of fire and accuracy, making it the perfect tool for training new shooters.

ThingDef.label: submachine gun
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated blowback submachine gun.\n\nFavouring volume of fire over a higher damage per shot, the submachine gun is surprisingly effective in the hands of a capable shooter, and is best used at close to medium range

ThingDef.label: automatic shotgun
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated long-stroke shotgun.\n\nFeeding from box magazines, the automatic shotgun has the potential to completely dominate any CQB encounter, but requires a skilled shooter to reliably land hits.

ThingDef.label: assault rifle
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated long-stroke assault rifle.\n\nFiring accurate 3 round bursts with decent damage and armour penetration, this firearm is ideal for short and medium range engagements.

ThingDef.label: battle rifle
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated short-stroke battle rifle.\n\nA semi-automatic rifle that hits hard, penetrates well, and provides quick follow-up shots.

ThingDef.label: light machine gun
ThingDef.description:
Gas-operated long-stroke light machine gun.

Fed by a disintegrating metallic link, this belt-fed machine gun is ideal for suppressing targets at extended ranges.

Can be mounted to a static tripod.

ThingDef.label: grenade launcher
ThingDef.description: Breech-loading grenade launcher.\n\nEssentially a big hollow tube with a firing pin at one end. Cheap and easy, just like your mother.

ThingDef.label: incendiary launcher
ThingDef.description: Pump-action grenade launcher.\n\nFeeds incendiary grenades from an underbarrel magazine tube.

ThingDef.label: smart launcher
ThingDef.description: Gas-operated grenade launcher.\n\nUsing a computer aided targeting system, the smart launcher is capable of making amazingly long ranged hits, but is only compatible with EMP greandes.

ThingDef.label: disposable launcher
ThingDef.description: Single-use rocket launcher.\n\nThe solid rocket motor that propels the warhead gives suprisingly good range, but limited accuracy, and as such is better used against dense groups of enemies to maximise effectiveness.

ThingDef.label: minigun
ThingDef.description: Multi-barrel gatling gun.\n\nDriven by an electric motor, this goliath is capable of firing 60 rounds per second. Truly, a force to be reckoned with.

ThingDef.label: large revolver
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern single-action revolver.

From ruptured cylinders to chain firing, this revolver has had a questionable history in saftey, though it is still coveted for it's raw power.

Fires a large-calibre pistol cartridges.

ThingDef.label: bolt-action pistol
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern bolt-action rifle, cut down to pistol size.

Most likely hacked up by some gang member on a distant urbworld, this "pistol" now lacks it's front sight, meaning accurate shots at ranges in exess of a few metres are all but laughable.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: service pistol
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-recoil pistol.

Uses a double-stack magazine design, which allows for a higher capacity when compared to contemporaries.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges

ThingDef.label: urban pistol
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, blowback, fully-automatic pistol.

Almost as common as a pair of shoes on more gang oriented urbworlds, it's cheap price and simple operation make for an attractive package.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: machine pistol
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-recoil, burst-fire pistol.

Originally used by police and counter-terrorism forces, now a favourite of bounty hunters and mercenaries alike.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage machine pistol
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-recoil, fully-automatic pistol.

One of the earliest designs of machine pistol, these finely crafted weapons are the product a well-known gunsmith and collector on a distant glitterworld.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: cheap submachine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern blowback submachine gun.

Crude construction, but fast and cost effective to build.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage submachine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern blowback submachine gun.

One of the earliest designs of submachine gun, it's heavy weight and awkward handling easily reflect this. The most commonly found examples are reproductions, and were lovingly crafted by a well-known gunsmith and collector from a distant glitterworld.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: bullpup PDW
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern blowback personal defence weapon.

The Bullpup PDW is chambered for a specially designed pistol cartridge, pupose-built for penetrating body armor. This, in tandem with it's high rate of fire and large magazine, prove that size does not matter.

Features a built-in reflector sight to help speed-up target acquisition.

ThingDef.label: polymer submachine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern blowback bullpup submachine gun.

Primarily found in the hands of paratroopers, this submachine gun is small, light, and easy to handle.

Features a telescopic sight with minimal magnification.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: sawn-off shotgun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern double-barreled shotgun, cut down to pistol size.

The go-to firearm for criminals of any race and creed.

Fires your run-of-the-mill buckshot.

ThingDef.label: lever-action shotgun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-action shotgun.

Generally overlooked in favour of a pump-action equivalent, the lever-action shotgun is still a perfectly serviceable firearm, and boasts a couple of advantages that seasoned gunslingers exploit to great effect.

Fires your run-of-the-mill buckshot.

ThingDef.label: semi-automatic shotgun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, recoil-operated shotgun.

Designed with police and military in mind, this shotgun has a dual-mode system, allowing for both pump action, and semi-automatic operation.

Fires your run-of-the-mill buckshot.

ThingDef.label: riot shotgun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern revolving shotgun, loaded with bean bag rounds.

Uses a rotating cylinder and double-action trigger, as opposed to a traditional gas system, to avoid the possibility of short-stroking when using underpowered and non-lethal rounds.

Fires less-than-lethal cartridges.

ThingDef.label: rugged carbine
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke carbine.

Converted from a longer variant, this stubby rifle is lauded by many as the perfect middle ground between power and size.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: compact carbine
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern roller-delayed carbine.

Features a telescopic stock and short barrel, making for a very compact and handy rifle.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: service carbine
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern direct impingement carbine.

As soon as the service rifle was adopted, a carbine version was being experimented with. Predictably, issues related to recoil and muzzle flash instantly emerged, and a large flash hider was quickly added to subsequent rifles.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: combat PDW
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke personal defense weapon.

An incredibly versatile carbine, due to the short barrel and collapsing stock, this PDW has become synonymous with security forces from worlds over.

Features a reflector sight and vertical foregrip, to help speed-up target acquisition. Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: weighted bullpup carbine
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke bullpup carbine.

The short barrel and bullpup configuration make for an extremely handy rifle, but means weight is awkwardly distributed toward the rear.

Features an extremely robust, but heavy optic, to help increase effective range.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: improvised rifle
ThingDef.description:
A simple blowback rifle.

Built by pirates and outlanders for training new shooters.

Fires a pathetically small pistol cartridge.

ThingDef.label: turret rifle
ThingDef.description:
Early rotating-cylinder percussion rifle.

More of a curiosity than a valid form of defence, this type of percussion rifle uses a vertically mounted rotating drum, with chambers bored radially as opposed to parallel with the barrel. Despite the known potential to maim the shooter, these rifles remain common in the hands of less wealthy or technologically apt communities.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: large lever-action rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-action rifle.

Uses a box magazine for safe loading of spitzer-type bullets.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: converted bolt-action rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern bolt-action rifle, converted to semi-auto.

As well as the addition of a larger magazine and pistol grip, a gas tube has been machined onto the side, which operates the bolt for the user.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: sporting rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern direct impingement rifle.

A civil, sporting variant of a popular military rifle.

Fitted with a short-range hunting scope and mahogany furniture.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage assault rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke assault rifle.

A reproduction of what is considered to be the first assault rifle, built by a well-known gunsmith and collector on a distant glitterworld. Original examples are still a much sought after collectors piece, though they are few and far between.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: rugged assault rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke assault rifle.

Whilst an exceedingly rare occurence, orignial recievers from thousands of years ago still turn up to this day; a testament to the ruggedness of this design.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: modernised rugged assault rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke assault rifle.

A modern take on an ageing legend.

Features an adjustable stock, vertical foregrip, and reflector sight, to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: service rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern direct impingement assault rifle.

Found in the hands of countless soldiers across numerous worlds, and with good reason.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: balanced bullpup rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-delayed bullpup assault rifle.

The action is located behind the trigger, making this a very compact weapon without sacrificing barrel length.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: modernised bullpup rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-delayed bullpup assault rifle.

The need for more modern attachments and optics forced this rifle's users to update the ageing weapons system. Fortunately, it was money well spent, and this variant can still be found hundreds of years after it's inception.

Features a reflector sight to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: light combat rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke assault rifle.

An incredibly flexible weapons platform, favoured by mercenaries and security forces.

Features a reflector sight and vertical foregrip, to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: polymer bullpup rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke bullpup assault rifle.

Primarily made from lightweight polymers, and features a telescopic sight with minimal magnification.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: weighted bullpup rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke bullpup assault rifle.

Despite it's weight, this rifle has earned a good reputation for it's phenomenal accuracy, and features an extremely robust, but heavy optic, to help increase effective range.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: prototype rifle
ThingDef.description:
Reproduction of an ancient prototype assault rifle.

At the time of it's creation, this rifle was the pinnacle of small arms technology. It was of a bullpup configuration, fired an intermediate cartridge, and had an integrated optic as standard. Unfortunately, it was very quickly un-adopted due to political problems concerning ammunition standardisation.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: defence rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke, fully-automatic battle rifle.

A rifle of unknown origin, it has found a small niche with well-off settlements.

Fires reduced-power rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: automatic battle rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke, fully-automatic battle rifle.

Favoured by old school veterans of wars long past, this particular variant came from the factory with the option of automatic fire.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: heavy combat rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke, fully-automatic battle rifle.

After the fall of a particularly well-armed glitterworld, thousands of these rifles appeared on the black market, and quickly earned a reputation as a reliable, and flexible platform.

Features a reflector sight and vertical foregrip, to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: rugged light support weapon
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke light support weapon.

Coveted by many for it's legendary reliability, it also features a 90% parts commonality with it's shorter barrelled brother.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: compact light machine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern roller-delayed blowback light machine gun.

Modified from surplus machine guns, these super short conversions showed up on the market after the destruction of a particularly large crime family.

Features a collapsible stock and verticle foregrip.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: polymer light support weapon
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke, bullpup light support weapon.

Rarely seen in conflict, these light support weapons are usually found in the hands of collectors.

Features a telescopic sight with minimal magnification.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: infantry automatic rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke automatic rifle.

This rifle's claim to fame is it's ability to switch dynamically from closed bolt to open bolt as heat builds up from automatic fire.

Features a reflector sight and vertical foregrip, to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: weighted light support weapon
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke bullpup light support weapon.

It was quickly discovered that the fixed barrel and small magazine made for a poor squad automatic weapon, however, it managed to stay in service as a DMR due to it's incredible accuracy.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage light machine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke light machine gun.

Originally fielded as aircraft guns, these weapons are the grandfathers of effective, man-portable, automatic fire. Most examples found today were built by a well-known gunsmith and collector on a distant glitterworld.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage general-purpose machine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern general-purpose machine gun.

Even after 3000 years of technological advancment, many modern ballistic weapons can still trace their lineage back to this machine gun's design. This example was built by a well-known gunsmith and collector on a distant glitterworld.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: general-purpose machine gun
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern general-purpose machine gun.

Originally replaced by lighter, intermediate calibre equivalents, these lumbering beasts have since been pressed back into service to help deal with the now increasingly common power-armoured soldiers found on modern battlefields.

Equipped with a magnified optic to help increase range and accuracy, and can also be mounted to a static tripod.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: breech-loading sniper
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern breech-loading rifle.

First used to great effect against tribals thousands of years ago, these rifles are now mostly found mounted to walls as decorative pieces.

This model features a basic rifle scope to help increase range and accuracy.

Fires a larger-than-average rifle calibre catridge.

ThingDef.label: lever-action sniper
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-action rifle.

From bandits, to heros, to simple farmers; This legendary rifle is known by all as "The gun that won the west".

This model features a basic rifle scope to help increase range and accuracy.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: recon rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern bolt-action rifle.

Features a precision rifle scope, straight-pull bolt, and match-grade barrel for the best possible accuracy.

Fires intermediate calibre, match-grade cartridges

ThingDef.label: rugged marksman's rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke marksman's rifle.

Whilst lacking it's contemporary's accuracy, it more than makes up for it in reliability.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: vintage sniper
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, long-stroke sniper rifle.

Initially fielded en masse as a front line service rifle; many of these now obsolete arms were drilled and tapped to allow the installation of a scope mount. Unfortunately this had a tendency to warp recievers, causing a reduction in accuracy. Whilst those orignal rifles can be still found on the market, most of the models found floating around today were scratch-built by a well-known gunsmith and collector on a distant glitterworld, and do not suffer the same poor accuarcy.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: special purpose rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, direct impingement marksman's rifle.

Designed to provide accurate long range fire, in as short a package as possible; the Special Purpose Rifle fills it's niche perfectly. It's remarkable performance can be attributed to the purpose-built match-grade ammunition, free-floating barrel, and precision rifle scope.

Fires match-grade, intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: sniper support rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke sniper support rifle.

It was common knowledge, at the time, that a semi-automatic rifle could never match the accuracy of a bolt-action. That was until the sniper support rifle was introduced. It's hefty cost meant it was primarily used by special forces and counter-insurgency groups, but that hasn't stopped it from being found in the hands of "the bad guys" every now and again.

Features a vertical foregrip, bipod, adjustable stock, free-floated barrel, precision rifle scope, and purpose-built match-grade ammunition, for the best possible accuracy.

ThingDef.label: anti-materiel rifle
ThingDef.description: Ancient pattern bolt-action anti-materiel rifle.\n\nWhilst the anti-materiel rifle was primarily designed for destroying military objects and materials, it also makes for an adequate, if combersome sniper, with catasrophic results on fleshy targets. Can also be used as a paper weight.

ThingDef.label: modernised arquebus
ThingDef.description:
Muzzle-loading matchlock arquebus.

The product of a bored gunsmith.

Features an adjustable stock, vertical foregrip, and reflector sight, to help speed-up target acquisition.

ThingDef.label: akimbo machine pistols
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-recoil, burst-fire pistols.

Upon closer inspection, these pistols are quite obviously clones of a genuine machine pistol, using service pistols as the starting point. Regardless, when paired together these pistols are almost unstoppable, but require a great deal of skill to keep under control.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: personalised bullpup PDW
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern blowback personal defence weapon.

Sprayed in a gloss pink, and emblazoned with a cartoon feline, this PDW was obviously much beloved by it's owner.

Features a suppressor, and built-in reflector sight to help speed-up target acquisition.

Fires a specially designed pistol cartridge, pupose-built for penetrating body armor.

ThingDef.label: akimbo lever-action shotguns
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern lever-action shotguns, cut down to a more manageable size.

Many believe that when paired together, these shotguns would grant the user wonderous power; incredible range, extreme damage, and seemingly limitless ammunition. Ridiculous.

Fires your run-of-the-mill buckshot.

ThingDef.label: vintage lever-action rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient lever-action rifle.

Nicknamed "yellowboy" due to it's gunmetal receiver, this original example is one of the oldest surviving weapons from the days of the old west, though how it ended up here is a complete mystery. It's likely that no one will recognise it's true worth for hundreds of years to come, and will continue to be abused for the forseeable future.

Fires pistol calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: gold-plated rugged assault rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern long-stroke assault rifle.

A symbol of wealth, for those who seek war. Ka-ching.

Fires intermediate calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: special operations rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke, fully-automatic battle rifle.

A Heavy Combat Rifle, modified over time by an unknown operator.

Features a vertical foregrip, laser module, suppressor, and magnified optic/reflector sight combo, to help increase range and speed-up target acquisition.

Fires rifle calibre cartridges.

ThingDef.label: modified light support weapon
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern short-stroke bullpup light support weapon.

This firearm most likely started life as a weighted light support weapon, but through countless years of exchanging hands, it has managed to acquire many unique modifications, one of which being an incredibly striking "Red Tiger" camouflage scheme.

Features a drum magazine, quick-change barrel, and assualt rifle handguard

Fires intermediate calibre jacketed hollow point cartridges.

ThingDef.label: automatic sniper rifle
ThingDef.description:
Ancient pattern, short-stroke sniper rifle.

A technical marvel, this rifle started life as failed project. It was originally intended as a semi-auto rifle, however, complications with the trigger pack made full-auto runways extremely common. Whilst this would have killed most projects, the groupings collected from these failed tests were still extremely tight, and it was decided that experimentation on a fully-automatic version would begin. Only 4 experiemental rifles were built before the government that was backing the project fell, and the rifles were quietly forgotten.

Features a free-floated barrel, precision rifle scope, and purpose-built match-grade ammunition, for the best possible accuracy.

ThingDef.label: quad launcher
ThingDef.description: Incediary rocket launcher.\n\nIntended to replace the flamethrower, this launcher was the focus of some criticism over the years, but is now quite the collectible. Fires a salvo of 4 rockets.
